JOHN L. MCCLELLAN, ARK.
EVERETT MCKINLEY DIRKSEN, ILL.
ROMAN L. KRUSKA, NEBR.
HIRAM L. FONG, HAWAII
HUGH SCOTT, PA.
JACOB K. JAVITS, N.Y.

^Cwieb J&en&ie
EDWARD M. KENNEDY, MASS.
BIRCH BAYH, IND.
QUENTIN N. BURDICK, N. DAK.
JOSEPH D. TYDINGS, MD.
GEORGE A. SMATHERS, FLA.
COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY
March 2, 1967
Mr. and Mrs. Henry G. Lee
418 23rd Avenue South
Grand Forks, North Dakota 58201
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Lee:
Thank you for letting me know your views on the
educational radio provisions which are expected
to be included in a bill which Senator Magnuson
will probably introduce dealing with educational
television facilities.
Mr. Myron Curry, whom you undoubtedly know, was
here in Washington and visited at length with one
of my assistants concerning the merits of this, and
it is now being given careful study. Again, thank
you for your views which I shall keep under
consideration.
With kind regards, I am
V-
Quentin N. Burdick
QNB:jme
